00048 [scriptable, uuid(d730af19-1b0b-4679-9f22-b41caa4ec59a)]
00049 interface sbIServicePaneNode : nsISupports
00050 {
00051   /* \brief the uri of this node as an RDF resource */
00052   readonly attribute nsIRDFResource resource;
00053   
00054   /* \brief the uri of this node as a string */
00055   readonly attribute AString id;
00056   
00057   /* \brief can this node have children */
00058   readonly attribute boolean isContainer;
00059   
00060   /* \brief the URL to load when the node is clicked on in the tree */
00061   attribute AString url;
00062   /* \brief the URL of the image to display in the tree */
00063   attribute AString image;
00064   /* \brief the name to display in the tree */
00065   attribute AString name;
00066   /* \brief the tooltip to display when the user hovers over the node in the tree */
00067   attribute AString tooltip;
00068   /* \brief should the node be hidden in the tree ? */
00069   attribute boolean hidden;
00070   /* \brief should the node name be editable in the tree ? */
00071   attribute boolean editable;
00072   /* \brief is the this node open in the tree? */
00073   attribute boolean isOpen;
00074   /* \brief the contract id of the service that owns the node */
00075   attribute AString contractid;
00076   
00077   /* drag and drop reordering helper attributes */
00078   /* \brief a comma separated list of drag types to offer for reordering */
00079   attribute AString dndDragTypes;
00080   /* \brief a comma separated list of drag types to allow to be reordered before or after */
00081   attribute AString dndAcceptNear;
00082   /* \brief a comma separated list of drag types to allow dropping into */
00083   attribute AString dndAcceptIn;
00084   
00085   /* \brief the uri of a stringbundle to use to translate the properties of this node */
00086   attribute AString stringbundle;
00087 
00088   /* \brief space separated list of property names, used to style the tree cell */
00089   attribute AString properties;
00090 
00091   
00092   // here's a subset of the W3C DOM Level 1 Core
00093   
00094   AString getAttributeNS(in AString aNamespace,
00095                          in AString aName);
00096   AString setAttributeNS(in AString aNamespace,
00097                          in AString aName,
00098                          in AString aValue);
00099   
00100   readonly attribute nsISimpleEnumerator childNodes;
00101   readonly attribute sbIServicePaneNode firstChild;
00102   readonly attribute sbIServicePaneNode lastChild;
00103   readonly attribute sbIServicePaneNode nextSibling;
00104   readonly attribute sbIServicePaneNode parentNode;
00105   readonly attribute sbIServicePaneNode previousSibling;
00106   
00107   sbIServicePaneNode appendChild (in sbIServicePaneNode aChild);
00108   sbIServicePaneNode insertBefore (in sbIServicePaneNode aNewNode,
00109                                    in sbIServicePaneNode aAdjacentNode);
00110   void removeChild (in sbIServicePaneNode aChild);
00111   void replaceChild (in sbIServicePaneNode aNewNode,
00112                      in sbIServicePaneNode aOldNode);
00113   
00114   
00115   // potential additions:
00116   // readonly attribute ownerDataSource; // like ownerDocument

00119   // AString setAttribute(in AString aName, in AString aValue);

00161 [scriptable, uuid(2a0a84b7-be67-40fb-8443-6e77a969820e)]
00162 interface sbIServicePaneService : nsISupports
00163 {
00167   readonly attribute nsIRDFDataSource dataSource;
00168 
00172   readonly attribute sbIServicePaneNode root;
00173 
00174   /* \brief Add a node to the tree
00175    * Create a new node and add it as a child of the specified parent. If a
00176    * child with the given id already exists then do not create it, and return
00177    * null. Otherwise return a node object.
00178    * \param aId an URN to use as the ID, or null if it should be anonymous
00179    * \param aParent the desired parent node
00180    * \param aContainer should the new node be a container
00181    * \return node object, or null if the node couldn't be created
00182    */
00183   sbIServicePaneNode addNode(in AString aId,
00184                              in sbIServicePaneNode aParent,
00185                              in boolean aContainer);
00186   
00187   /* \brief Remove a node and all its children
00188    * Remove a node from the tree and all its children and all their childen and
00189    * so on.
00190    * \param aNode the node to remove
00191    */
00192   void removeNode(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode);
00193   
00194   /* \brief Get the node object for the given id
00195    * \param aId the ID of the desired node
00196    * \return node object, or null if it couldn't be found
00197    */
00198   sbIServicePaneNode getNode(in AString aId);
00199 
00200   /* \brief Get the first node object for the given url
00201    * \param aURL the url of the desired node
00202    * \return node object, or null if it couldn't be found
00203    */
00204   sbIServicePaneNode getNodeForURL(in AString aURL);
00205 
00206   /* \brief Save the state of the tree to disk.
00207    * This should go away and be handled magically
00208    */
00209   void save();
00210 
00211   /* \brief Fill the context menu for the given node
00212    * \param aId the id of the node
00213    * \param aContextMenu the menu we're trying to fill
00214    * \param aParentWindow the toplevel window we're displaying in
00215    */
00216   void fillContextMenu(in AString aId,
00217                        in nsIDOMXULElement aContextMenu,
00218                        in nsIDOMWindow aParentWindow);
00219   
00220   /* \brief Fill a menu with menuitems to create new tree nodes
00221    * \param aId the id of the node or null for the click and hold menu
00222    * \param aContextMenu the menu we're trying to fill
00223    * \param aParentWindow the toplevel window we're displaying in
00224    */
00225   void fillNewItemMenu(in AString aId,
00226                        in nsIDOMXULElement aContextMenu,
00227                        in nsIDOMWindow aParentWindow);
00228   
00229   /* \brief Selection changes notification
00230    * \param aId the id of the node that is now selected
00231    * \param aContainer The container object that implements the selection
00232    * \param aParentWindow the toplevel window we're displaying in
00233    */
00234   void onSelectionChanged(in AString aId,
00235                           in nsIDOMNode aContainer,
00236                           in nsIDOMWindow aParentWindow);
00237   
00238   /* I think we'll need to have this interface too:
00239   nsITreeView wrapTreeView(in nsITreeView aTreeView);
00240   it will take an existing tree-builder tree view and add some
00241   functionality that we want to have
00242   */
00243   
00244   /* drag and drop support */
00245   PRBool canDrop(in AString aID,
00246                  in nsIDragSession aDragSession,
00247                  in PRInt32 aOrientation);
00248   void onDrop(in AString aID,
00249               in nsIDragSession aDragSession,
00250               in PRInt32 aOrientation);
00251   PRBool onDragGesture(in AString aID,
00252                        out nsITransferable aTransferable);
00253 
00254   /* \brief Called when a node is renamed by the user, allows
00255    *        the node owner to accept the action by setting the
00256    *        node name to the given value.
00257    * \param aId the ID of the node being renamed
00258    * \param aNewName new name entered by the user
00259    */
00260   void onRename(in AString aID,
00261                 in AString aNewName);
00262 
00263 };

00270 [scriptable, uuid(9c87f9d3-164d-4786-b044-9f72472a95b2)]
00271 interface sbIServicePaneModule : nsISupports
00272 {
00273   /* \brief Initialize this service pane module
00274    * This is where the module should set itself up in the tree if it hasn't
00275    * before.
00276    * \param aServicePaneService the service pane service instance
00277    */
00278   void servicePaneInit(in sbIServicePaneService aServicePaneService);
00279   
00280   /* \brief Fill the context menu for the given node
00281    * \param aNode the node that was context-clicked on
00282    * \param aContextMenu the menu we're trying to fill
00283    * \param aParentWindow the toplevel window we're displaying in
00284    */
00285   void fillContextMenu(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00286                        in nsIDOMXULElement aContextMenu,
00287                        in nsIDOMWindow aParentWindow);
00288   
00289   void fillNewItemMenu(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00290                        in nsIDOMXULElement aContextMenu,
00291                        in nsIDOMWindow aParentWindow);
00292 
00293   /* \brief Selection changes notification
00294    * \param aNode the node that is now selected
00295    * \param aParentWindow the toplevel window we're displaying in
00296    */
00297   void onSelectionChanged(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00298                           in nsIDOMNode aContainer,
00299                           in nsIDOMWindow aParentWindow);
00300 
00301   PRBool canDrop(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00302                  in nsIDragSession aDragSession,
00303                  in PRInt32 aOrientation);
00304   void onDrop(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00305               in nsIDragSession aDragSession,
00306               in PRInt32 aOrientation);
00307   PRBool onDragGesture(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00308                        in nsITransferable aTransferable);
00309 
00310   /* \brief Called when a node is renamed by the user, allows
00311    *        the module to accept the action by setting the
00312    *        node name to the given value.
00313    * \param aNode the node that was renamed
00314    * \param aNewName new name entered by the user
00315    */
00316   void onRename(in sbIServicePaneNode aNode,
00317                 in AString aNewName);
00318   
00319   /* \brief optional URI of stringbundle to use to localize names of nodes
00320     associated with this module */
00321   readonly attribute AString stringbundle;
00322 };
